choices: The same black creatures from before are everywhere
1.content:
((Warning: very long intro))

"Where am I?" you ask yourself before opening your eyes. You were in a train car of some sort along with other strange creatures and people. You look at the reflective metal on the ceiling to find that you were a human male wearing a green T-shirt and blue jeans. Your blond hair had a golden hue while you couldnt help but look at the other people who were just as curious. You stuck your hand in your pocket to feel a card and took it out.

It read "YOUR NAME IS: Frend PRONOUNCED LIKE: Friend" in a (insert name here) kind of way.

"Frend... Frend" you repeated to yourself, getting used to having a name. You also noticed that everyone had a card containing their name.

"Welcome new creations" you heard a voice over the loud speaker "as you get used to your names I would like introduce myself as Hudson Speaker. A little info about our destination Centertown, Centertown is like a Lobby connecting all five diffrent worlds together, Fantacy, Sci-Fi, Historical Fiction, Anime, and Speed Worlds. You are the creations of many minds, drawn in paper you have been created and now will reside in this world, if you have any questions please visit the library at Centertown. Now a few rules before we get to Centertown, one, no fighting in Centertown or we will have to punish you severly. Two, you are only allowed into worlds that you are compatable to and centertown, so no going into other worlds that you were not made for. Three, have fun and pro..."

Hudson was cut off as an explosion racked through the entire car, everything shook as black things broke through the windows and started to grab some of the people. You stood up to try and fight off the creatures but someone or somthing slammed into you, sending you breaking through the window and falling in a white world. You got a glance down at what looked like a pencil drawing of a town, but it ended quickly as you fell through the roof of a house.

Moaning, you opened your eyes to see the white bridge that the train was on in the roof of the house you just made. Getting up, you rubbed the back of your head and looked around the room you were in. You couldnt help but yawn as the bed room was as bland and as vanila as it could get, there was absolutly no color. Going down the stairs you found yourself in the living room just as void of color as the bedroom. Sitting on the sofa watching static on the telivision was a person who was in a robe and holding a pen, he too was void of all color, like a pen drawing.
"Hello?" you asked, waiting for a responce, but the man didn't ancwer. Hesitantly you reached out and poked the man, and instantly color flowed into his body, changing his apperence drasticly.

The man had black hair that looke like it was dunked in black ink while the man was now clothed in a strange robe with what could be described as the sleave version of bell bottoms, bell bottoms, and a beret on his head. Parts of his clothing covered in black splotches. He also wore a red and blue scarf around his neck that covered up his mouth very effectively, and the man was now missing his right arm, only a mangled up sleeve left in it's place. The pen he was holding turned into a giant green and twisted fountain pen.

"I LIVE!" The man yelled as he erupted from his seat and turned to you.
"THANK YOU, THANK YOU VERY MUCH FOR GIVING ME MY COLOR BACK!" He then caughed and said "sorry, my name is Splotchy Ink, and yours?"
"Frend" You replied, kind of caught off guard by the sudden outburst of energy, "and what happened to you?"
Splotchy smiled (or at least you thought he did) as he said "remember what Hudson said about fighting in Centertown?"
"I think he said somthing about punishment" you said "and I take it that this is punishment"
"Yes it is Frend" Splotchy said "and unfortunatly I was bound to be colorless forever, but thanks to you I AM FREE!!!"
You stepped back and said "please don't go out and start killing everyone."
Splotchy looked at you surprised and said "why heck no, I learned my lesson thanks to you." He then bowed down "how may I be of service."
"Taking me to Centertown would be nice" you said hoping that you can get out of the colorless void.
Splotchy laughed "why of course"

Then unexpectedly, the scarf that hung down his back wrapped around the giant pen and drew a large hole right under you. You fell through and landed into the grass, with Splotchy landing right next to you.
Looking up you first saw five large doors, but your attention was diverted by Splotchy turning your head back to what looked like a large kingdom. But...
1.title: You have been created

choices: You fight off the strange blot creatures
One of the creatures drains all the color out of you
11.content:
People were running everywhere in panic, and half the people wernt human, some were dragons, anthro furs, and other creatures I could not realy identify. The strange monsters that were chasing them though were obvious, completly black like walking ink blots.
"SPLOTCHY!" yelled what looked like a dragon, and by the sound of her voice it was a girl dragon.
One of the black creatures leaped on top of the dragon and started to suck out the color, the creature in question becoming larger and larger. I then saw Splotchy leap up on the dragon and stuck the tip of his pen into the black creature. It screamed as it was then sucked into Splotchy's pen. The dragoness colapsed on the ground, her color faded out a little.
"Shela" Splotchy gasped as he then touched the dragoness with the tip of his pen and started restoring her color "what in the world is happening here?"
Shela took a gulp of air for a second before saying "those black creatures, they seemed to come out from nowhere. At first they only roamed the corners of the other world, but then they grew in power untill entire worlds were taken over. It was so bad that we had to lock the doors, but they were able to leak through."
Splotchy then started to draw somthing and threw it towards you. It looked like cross between a paintbrush and a sword.
"Frend, get the little ink blots while I try and take on the larger ones" Splotchy said before running into the village.
11.title: The same black creatures from before are everyw...

choices: Splotchy stabs it in the back.
The angelic woman comes to my aid.
I tried to run for it.
111.content:
I held the strange weapon before me in awe. I've never used a real sword before, unless you'd could the occassions I swung a stick around.
"Don't just stand there you have to fight."
"But I've never-"
"Now's not the time. If you don't, the world will fall apart." replied Splotchy in an unusually sharp voice. "You have the choice to either stay and fight or run away, but they'll find you and your color eventually and then you'll be all alone. I'd recommend going with the first option."
I was at a lack for words then I took a deep breath and charged in. I came upon on another person being drained of color from the creatures. She looked human at first, but here wings gave her an angelic appearance. I dispatched the creature with ease, its body burst into black droplets or paint. I thought it was dead, but then it started to reform itself again. I was about to panic, but the Splotchy shouted to me. I turned to see him engaged in combat with several of the creatures, but kept a deal of his attention on me.
"Stab the inks with the hilt of your sword to vanquish them."
I quickly did so and the creature began to be drawn into the sword. As it happened, color dripped down the blade and dripped off the end of the sword. Instead of merely falling to the ground it curved and splattered on the woman who still laid on the ground drained of her natural hue. The color absorbed into her and with it her state returned to normal.
I didn't have time to stay for a thank you as my actions alarmed more of the creatures. They came from all size and soon a dozen surrounded me. Three melted into the ground and rushed at my feet, but I jumped backwards. One came at me from behind, but I heard the grotesque shriek it made and twisted my body cut its body in two. A second pair came at me, but I cut the first and dodged the second. After it landed it prepared to come at me again, but it didn't have the chance as I was already coming at it and cut it down. I turned to the remaining creatures and they began to sink into the ground. I thought they were retreating, but they began merging together. Even the ones I cut down had pulled themselves together to merge. The creatures emerged as a single jugernaut of the creatures. It was a head over me and twice as vicious. I didn't give it a chance to attack and sliced its arm off. The creature roared, but it wasn't defeated. The arm merely returned to an ink state and returned to its body and a new arm formed. It then came at me, claws swinging fiercely. My heart was pumping, I couldn't fight something like this. I wasn't a warrior. Suddenly...
111.title: The Brushblade

choices: Didn't have enough color to restore everyone
Just enough color to restore everyone
13.content:
"Holy cow" you heard Splotchy said as he looked at the black and white village.
"I take it this normaly isn't like this" you said to Splotchy but he didn't ancwer you, instead he asked while scratching his head "what in the world happened while I was gone?"

Deciding to search the village, you and Splotchy walked into the village. Instantly you met color less women and men in the same white robes standing in the street doining nothing. There were even what Frend thought to be little dinosaurs but were also colorless standing on the side of the street doing nothing.

Then, you saw a black creature run toward Splotchy.
"WATCH OUT!" you yelled as the creature was bound to take down Splotchy.
Swinging his giant pen that was almost as large as you at the monster, Splotchy took down the creature as it wriggled on the ground. Getting a good look you noticed that the creature looked like it was made out of a black liquid, forming into anything it needed. The monster was about to stand back up but Splotchy stuck his pen into the beast's gut and sucked it up inside the pen.

Splotchy then started drawing what looked like a sword, except that it also looke like a large eyedropper filled with multi colored ink.
"Here Frend, take this and help restore the color in some of these people" Splotchy said "just touch them with the end of the dropper or squert ink on them, don't bother restoring the buildings, the people will more likely be of more use."
"Why can't I just touch them like I did with you?" you asked curiously.
"Well, you can" Splotchy said "but you would drain your own color and become a mindless black and white mannequin like everyone else."

You and Splotchy ran around restoring the people in the village and...
13.title: Black and White Wasteland

131.content:
You ran through the village, hitting passerbys along the way to return there color. It seemed almost effortless to the point it was un nerving. You expected more resistance but you havent encountered one of those black blot things.
Turning into the ally you ran into what looked like a shadow of Splotchy. The shadow looked back at you and started turning into your siloet. The both of you looked at each other, the thing was uncanny to you other than being completly black.
131.title: There's trouble brewing

choices: Your doppleganger is about to defeat you
1311.content:
You jumped back as the shadow version of you swung his sword. You attacked but your doppleganger slunked back to try and counter attack. You were hit, as part of you was erased. It was scary because while the bottom half was firmly on the ground your other half was floating right above it. You didn't have much time to look at yourself as your doppleganger took out part of your arm.
It was now a sword fight, each of you were matched as both of you had the same strengths and weaknesses. This puzzled you as if the creature stayed in Splotchy's form then it would have easily beaten you, but it changed into a form that matched you.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------------------------

Splotchy on the other hand was surrounded tens of human shaped black blobs.
"Blast, there were more than I expected" Splotchy said to himself "better regroup back with Frend, he might be in trouble."
Whicking his pen in the air, Splotchy started to quickly draw in the air and created another of him, and another, and another. Each one started to attack the group of ink monsters before they could reach the real Splotchy.

One of the monsters leaped over the baricade and attacked Splotchy, sending him to the ground and go splat, covering the pavement with black ink. It wasn't the real one.
The real one at the moment was running in Frend's direction.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- ---------------------------------

You were on your last leg as you fought your doppleganger, who was also on it's last leg too. You swung, and lunged, your double swung and lunged back, it was a tie, the way either of you were going to win was going to be determined by fate.
1311.title: The shadow attacks

13113.content:
As your doppleganger lunged at you, you suddenly here a shout of "Now Renamon" followed by a shout of "Diamond storm". Suddenly your doppleganger was struck by multiple sharp diamonds, then fell to the ground as a pool of black ink.

Turning aroud you see a red haired girl and humanoid fox. Due to the mind you were created from, you recognise these two immediatly as Renamon and Rika from Digimon. You quickly thank them as Splotchy shows up. But will he recognise them as friend or foe?
13113.title: Someone comes to your rescue

131131.content:
You stuck your weapon into the ink and sucked the ink up as Splotchy ran up to you.
"Hey Frend, are you all right" Splotchy asked conserned.
"Yah I'm alright" you told him pointing towards Rika and Renamon "thanks to them."
"Well thank you very..." Splotchy began to say before he relized who he was talking to. His head then sunk a little deeper into his scarf as he said "oh bugger."
Rika certanly looked angery, pointing at Splotchy saying "YOU, YOU WERE THE ONE WHO STARTED THIS AGAIN!"
Splotchy took several steps back saying nerviously "I know what your trying to say, but it's not me this time I swear."
"Renamon" Rika commanded pointing to Splotchy "destroy him before he causes any more trouble."
"Yes Rika" Renamon replied as she charged towards Splotchy yelling "Diamond storm!" Hundreds of diamonds hurled towards Splotchy, but he quickly drew a circle that filled in with color. The attack was deflected but Renamon zipped around behind Splotchy to punch him in the back.
"Urk" before Renamon's puch could contact Splotchy, she was lifted up by the neck by Splotchy's scarf.
"Listen to me, this is not my fault" Splotchy said a little more calmly, "please, I was the one who brought your color back."
Rika took a step back, "Realy?" she asked.
"Yah realy, but we need to get going" Splotchy said "we need to destroy the rest of these creatures."
131131.title: Friend

1311311.content:
You, Rika, and Renamon followed Splotchy through the empty shell of Centertown, destroying the strange ink creatures whenever they showed up. During the ocasional lulls of fighting you would wonder about Splotchy's past and his reasons for turning the world blank. Yet you still trusted Splotchy, even though you now knew is... intresting past.

-------------------------------------------------

Hidden somewhere in the World of Fiction, was a large white and rectangular factory.
"Master Artist" said a strange looking ink creature in armor "our take over of Centertown has hit a... snag."
A large chair in a black room faced away from the ink creature and towards a large flat screen.
"My ink army hitting a snag?" asked the Master Artist, "who could be powerfull enough to hinder my progress of my masterpiece?" The screen then flickered to show an airial view of Centertown before zooming in on one of the streets where the four were now walking. The picture then froze and zoomed in on Frend.
"Nah, he might be an itch, but he can easily be scratched." The picture then zoomed in on Rika and Renamon.
"Rika and Renamon on the other hand might be a TINY problem... wait, I thought my minions sucked the ink out of her?" The Master Artist then gasped, "wait, who has the power to bring back someone with Rika's and Renamon's potential." The screen then zoomed in on Splotchy's face.
The Master Artist groaned "I just HAD to ask."
"What's the problem?" The minion asked "I thought Splotchy was turned into a Blank?"
"He was" the Master Artist said "but what realy conserns me is who could be powerfull and creative enough to bring Splotchy back from the Blank."
The minion nodded his head saying "but Master Artist, what do we do with Splotchy and the others."
The Master Artist sighed before saying, "tell the commanders to...
1311311.title: Sticking together

13113112.content:
retreat."
"Retreat!" the minion burst out "but Master?"
"Don't worry, Centertown is the least of my concerns" the Master Artist replied, "Splotchy and who ever revived him is now top priority. Have the remaining troops seperated evenly and distributed to the five diffrent worlds."
"Good thinking Master" the minion said "with more troops in the worlds it would be easyer to set up a counter attack. We could literaly surround them right when they enter the door." The minion then turned around and left the room eagerly.
The Master Artist then chuckled, "So, this is how it's going to be my dear Splotchy Ink. It's going to be intresting seeing who has more power, me, the Master Artist, or the legendary Splotchy Ink."

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- --

"What's this" Splotchy wondered as he saw the rest of the ink creatures run away.
"I cant beleve it," you said "they are retreating!"
"I don't like this" Splotchy said to himself as he added color to several more resedents, "I may not be a tactical genius, but this smells like a trap."
"Well, there's not much else we can do" Renamon said calmly.
You then looked around at the blank town and asked "Splotchy, is there anything we can do about Centertown?"
"There is" Splotchy replied, "but it will take a bit of time." Splotchy then pointed over towards the five doors and added "but while we are away, the lack of those ink creatures will allow the town to regain it's color, and the more color there is the stronger the residents become. Some of the still blank resedents might even get some color back while we are away."
Rika turned towards the doors and asked "so, which world do we go to first?"
13113112.title: The Retreat.

131131121.content: Fantacy, Sci-Fi, or Historical Fiction
131131121.title: Fantacy, Sci-Fi, or Historical Fiction

13113112111.content:
As they stepped through the doorway, the four heroes found themselves in... a restroom of all places.
"What is that horrible smell?!" exclaimed Rika, as she and Renamon held their noses.
"Well, we are in a loo," stated Splotchy.
Their question was soon answered. There was a loud flush, and an enormous orange dragon emerged from a nearby stall. A strand of toilet paper hung from beneath his tail.
"No more pork stew for me!" the dragon muttered to himself with a thick British accent as he excited the stall. He then noticed the four people who were staring at him with confusion.
"Oh, hello there!" said the dragon cheerfully, "I'm Elruze, and who might you be?"
The group introduced themselves.
"You have a little, um," Splotchy began, gesturing towards the dragon's rear.
"Oh! Thank you," said Elruze, with some embarrassment. He went back to the stall and removed the dangler, flushed again, then went to the sink and began washing his claws.
"I'm confused," said Splotchy, "I thought this was Fantasy?"
"It is," said the dragon, "But we have recieved a few modern updates," Noticing the group's continued confusion, he added, "Here, let me show you."
As they excited the bathroom, the group found themselves in a traditional western fantasy setting. Everything seemed relatively normal at first, then they passed a few peasants cooling themselves with miniature fans and a minstrel with an electric guitar.
"Hear ye, hear ye!" shouted a crier, "The king would like to make an announcement!"
"It's about time he got away from that silly telly," said the dragon.
"So," you begin, "It seems relatively peaceful here..."
"Oh, it's very peaceful," said Elruze, "No real fighting, hunger, or disease."
"I wonder, " Splotchy mused quietly, "Could these drastic alterations to the stereotype be affecting this world's resistance to the ink creatures somehow? They don't seem to have targeted it."
"May I ask you something?" he said to Elruze.
"Certainly, ask away," Elruze said.
"Do you have any real problems here, any serious threats or dangers to your way of life?" Splotchy asked.
"Well, there is the occasional appearance of demons," Elruze replied.
"Demons? What sort of demons?" Splotchy asked.
The dragon began to describe...
13113112111.title: Modern Conveinances

131131121112.content:
"Well, they look like big blots of black water in the rough shape of humans" Elruze began to describe, "yet they wear this weird armor over there body, some peices move and form as if they were made from quick silver."
"Blast it, they already discovered Mercury Armor" Splotchy said as he stomped his foot in the ground.
"Wait," you asked "you mean they use Mercury as armor? Isn't that stuff poisonous?"
"No and yes, no they do not use Mercury as armor, but yes Mercury is poisonus." Splotchy explained, "I call it Mercury Armor is because it 'looks' like Mercury, like liquid metal. It immedeiatly forms at the area your going to hit before you hit, thus protecting the Blots with very little armor."
"That sucks" Rika said slightly dissapointed before looking at Renamon and asked "do you think you might be able to hit them fast enough before they block you?"
"I will try Rika" Renamon said in her mellow tone.
Elruze looked at the group with a confused expression and asked "what's so terrible about them, they havn't really hurt anyone yet. All they do is protect this one area and it isn't even an important area."
"Where?" Splotchy asked looking up at Elruze with a very serious look.
"Oh, at Carpenter Canyon" Elruze said "why is that so important?"
"This whole thing is a set up, a way of softening the communitie's unique and colorful character," Splotchy said in a serious and grave tone, "don't you see, everything is all modern because the blots want you to use this technology over magic."
"But this place hasn't had a conflict in some time" Elruze said even more confused.
"The Blots don't want conflict, they want an organized community" Splotchy said waving his arms around.
"Then you would be daft to stop somthing like that" Elruze replied looking at Splotchy as if he was a mad man out to cause havoc.
"Do you know HOW they are going to create an organized community?" Splotchy asked before answering himself "BY DRAINING YOUR COLOR AND ENSLAVING YOUR FREE WILL!"
"Well that isn't a jolly good way of doing it" Elruze said tilting his head, "and considering that your new here I guess you want me to take you to Carpenter Canyon?"
"It would certanly help" you said to Elruze.
"Well then, just follow me" Elruze said as he began to lumber off.
What they found at Carpenter Canyon was...
131131121112.title: It's worse than originaly expected

1311311211121.content:
Reaching the edge of the canyon, you peer over to see an enormous grey mountain sheltered in the basin. Looking at it for a short while, you see it begin to move, a sort of jiggling motion. Then a hole appears at the base and several smaller blobs exit the mass. They cluster together to form an armoured blot.
"This is much worse than I expected," Splotchy said grimly, "With a device like this, they could theoretically produce a boundless army of ink creatures!"
"Hey, Mister Splotchy," Elruze began, "I know that this is an unusually bad time, but I really must know, if the technology was created by the ink creatures, than will we have to give it up?"
"No, I doubt it," Splotchy replied, "The technology isn't really the problem, so much as what the ink creatures are doing with it. When this whole thing is settled out, you should be able to keep everything."
"Alright, "Elruze said, "That's good, because I really am not too keen on pooping on the ground. Toilets are far more civilized."
"That machine looks very well defended," you say, noticing at least fifty soldiers on either side of the blob, keeping watch.
"You're right, "Splotchy said, "Elruze, I need you to do something for me."
"What is it?" the dragon asked.
1311311211121.title: The Grey Titan

13113112111212.content:
"Are you sure, I mean, I might be civilized but I can put up a good fight" Elruze said a little disapointed.
"That's the exact reason why I want you to get help" Splotchy said, making the situation as clear as mud.
You looked at Splotchy asking, "that dosn't make a single bit of sense."
"It does when the certan peice of help happens to be leading the bregade of blanks around the factory" Splotchy said as he cupped his ear and began to listen. Soon enough there was a rythmic tap that slowly increased in volume as a large square of blanks marched around the moutain lead by a person drained by all of there color playing a drum. There was an obvious trait that stuck out about the person, was that his shoulders were about to touch the bottom of his ears.
"I can't beleve that they brought Rave.N all the way here, he must have put up one heck of a fight" Splotchy said as he chuckled at his friend's fate, "it surprises me that I can still recognize him."
"What's so funny about seeing your friend turned into a colorless being" you asked with a bit of distaste. That was when you heard the tap start to burst out in a storm of complicated rythms and patterns before returning to the single series of taps.
"That's what's funny" Splotchy said. "Rave is one of those people who don't know how to quit... strike that, CAN'T quit. It's pritty much hard wired in his brain."
Splotchy then pointed at the drained person and said to Elruze, "get that person and bring him to me, he's all the backup we need. Just make sure you don't get drained yourself."
"I still say your underestimating my bloody fighting capeabilities" Elruze said with a grunt before leaping into the air.
Splotchy sighed saying, "that's the problem, you are underestimating them already."

Elruze dived down to swipe the colorless person in his claws before flapping his wings to gain air. There was a large explosion as the armored blot fired a large glob of ink at the escaping dragon. Elruze flew left and right dodging the blobs of ink, but felt one of his legs go numb as a blot of ink hit and surounded his leg. He felt week as his scails started to become dull and pale. Still, with a last few flaps he was back at the top of the basin before collapsing on landing.
"I don't feel very good" Elruze said with a groan.
"That's because you underestimated them" Splotchy replied as he tended to the grey indavidual saying to you, "help Elruze regain some color, we are going to need his help later."
You went up to Elruze and started to recolor him, not noticing that the surrounding area got a little brighter. Finnishing up Elruze you looked to see how Splotchy was doing to see what seemed like a walking neon sighn. Acutaly he looked like a colorful band director with his wide shoulders shoved almost all the way up to his ears while his entire suit seemed to light up like it was made of neon.
"Let me introduce you to Rave-N" Splotchy said as Rave-N bowed. "He's kind of like me but with music, so I think he can help us."
That was when a bubbly roar rumbled the ground.
"There about to attack" Splotchy said
13113112111212.title: Rave-N of hope

131131121112121.content:
"What are we going to do now?" you shout above the roar of the blob.
"Chill, man, I got this one," Rave-N says calmly. He snaps his fingers and produces a strange instrument out of the air. It looks like an accordion combined with an electric guitar and a harp.
"I'll take out the cannons," Rave-N says, "You cats go for the blob itself."
The blob rumbles again and the cannons hum, all aimed on your position. Rave-N does not hesitate. He strums the electric guitar furiously and plucks a few strings on the harp, then jams a low cord on the piano. A force field appears around you, and not a moment too soon. The cannons fire, but their shots are absorbed by the force field. The field dissipates after the cannons power down.
"Well, that was close one, now its our turn!" Splotchy says.
"Alright, like I said: you guys on the blob, this brother's got the cannons. You dig me?"
"We've got it," Elruze says.
"Okay then, let's Funk these guys!" Rave-N says. He jams out a rock medley on his guitar, and angry red chords fly through the air, slamming into one of the cannons, causing it to explode in a shower of sparks and wires.
The five of you rush towards the blob, as Rave-N continues to blast the cannons with rock-n-roll. When a cannon takes aim and prepares to fire, he jams out a smooth Reggae blend and a string of notes surround him, causing the ink to deflect off harmlessly into the mountains.
You dash into the ranks of the armored ink soldiers at the base of the canyon on your way to assault the blob. You slash out with your pen, Renamon attacks with Diamond Storm, Elruze whirls about, scratching with his massive claws, and Splotchy attacks by hurling colored pencils like arrows.
"There's too many!" you shout as the soldiers begin to overwhelm you, thanks to their powerful armor and superior numbers.
"We'll have to retreat!" Renamon says.
"I've got you!" Rave-N shouts, "This oughta unbalance the odds in your favor!"
He strums a Salsa beat, then plays the Blues. The ink soldiers slow down to almost a crawl around you and you feel power rushing through your body. Unfortunately for Rave-N, the blob took the opportunity to spray a huge stream of ink his way, and he is unable to defend himself in time.
"Rave-N, NO!" you cry out as the ink drenches the neon man.
"You cats keep fightin', I think I'll just stay here and doze for a while, man." Rave-N says, as his monochrome form slumps to the ground and he falls asleep.
"I'm going back for him!" you shout.
"No!" Splotchy says, "They'll send in reinforcements if we don't finish this quickly!"
131131121112121.title: ATTACK

choices: A black and white wasteland, lots of Ink blots
13113112112.content:
Splotchy looks at all three of you "the sci fi world might be the best".

"Wait" you say "if its a sci fi world, wont that mean the boss of the area is really hard to beat?"

"Maybe, but some of the most powerful people are in there" Renamon said.

"Renamon's right, I've heard about the kind of people in that world, from those power ranger people to armoured superhuman giants and giant monsters capable of wiping out entire armies" Rika added.

"But wont they have some of that kind of people as well?" you ask.

Splotchy nods "maybe, but the power we gain could be of immense help to us" he points out.

You sigh "ok, lets go" you say, as all four of you walk through the door.

But inside?
13113112112.title: Sci-Fi

choices: Three hatches open and you all fall through.
A native turned traitor shows up.
131131121121.content: As your group enters you notice something is very wrong. The entire place is black and white, and blots are plentiful. As the blots charge at the group you pull out the dropper/sword and swing it at the blots, destroying a few and filling the dropper up a bit. Splotchy was handleing a bigger group of blots with his brush while Rika and Renamon we're blasting away at some blots when suddenly...
131131121121.title: A black and white wasteland, lots of Ink blots

choices: Rika and Renamon to the rescue... again.
Splotchy strikes the Lictor while its distracted.
1311311211212.content:
Suddenly out of the blue a sinister shape leaps out at you. Recognising the being to be a Lictor from Warhammer, you leap back barely avoiding its deadly blows. You keep blocking blow after blow but you know your not going to last long.

Suddenly...
1311311211212.title: A native turned traitor shows up.

13113112112122.content:
Splotchy slid holding up the giant pen between you and the Lictor before your last block, stopping the Lictor in it's tracks. Swinging the huge pen's large blades perched at the end of it's twist, Splotchy struck the Lictor sending it backwards. You watched as Splotchy stuck the tip of his pen into the beast's neck and start draining and you couldn't help see a sinister look into Splotchy's eye before shaking himself out of it. The Lictor was not only black and white, but looked a little more human too.

Splotchy then looked towards you, Renamon, and Rika before drawing a canvas and handing it to you.
"Quick, I need you to find a good vantage point, perferably somewhere high up and with a good view of most of the area" Splotchy requested before taking out a few more ink creatures. "Quick, the faster you put that canvas somewhere the faster I can color in a big chunk of this world and eliminate plenty of those ink creatures."

You nodded and started to run for it along with Renamon and Rika, looking for somewhere that will give you a good view over the entire area. Unfortunatly because everything is so blank and bland the terrain is also quite flat except for a....
13113112112122.title: Splotchy to the rescue!

131131121121222.content:
Somewhere close by among the square white houses that lined up perfectly in a grid was a large rectangular grey building with several tall smokestacks that billowed out pixilated smoke. It was a large factory, more likely used for inslaving the colorless residents in a boring routeen, but it was also in the perfect place for a great view. Problem was, it was filled with both the colorless citizens of that world but also with hundreds of the ink blot creatures.

"RIKA!" Renamon yelled in horror as she saw her trainer's colors begin to fade. You also saw that Renamon's colors were fading too, traveling the ground like colorfull shadows towards the factory.
"Now that's how they do it" you said to yourself as you watched your own color drift away, but oddly enough you didn't fade near as quickly as either Rika or Renamon.
"Renamon" you commanded "tell Splotchy that I found a good vantage point and direct him here. He should return the color of both you and your trainer." Renamon nodded, grabbed Rika and started darting towards Splotchy in a distance.

Now you had a problem, how to get up the side of the seam less side of the building. Climbing was out of the question, but an idea came to you while you looked at the eye dropper like sword. You placed the tip on the ground and dragged it and sure enough, a black line was being drawn on the ground. A few more lines later and you had a ladder, but the real question was if it was just a real ladder or if it was a drawing of a ladder. Grabbing the black rungs, you struggled to pull it off the ground, but after some work you were able to lean the ladder up the side of the factory. With one arm around the canvas you quickly scailed the ladder up the factory wall, but the ladder shook violently. Taking a quick glance down you saw more of those shadow creatures climbing up the ladder behind you.

"Oh blast" you muttered before scrambling up as fast as you could. One of the shadow creatures lached on to your ankle, but a quick swipe of your sword took care of it but also almost sent you falling off. Finaly, you reached the roof of the factory, and with great satisfaction you pushed the ladder off, sending the ink creatures splattering on the ground along with the ladder.

You then waited, but in no time you heard a pair of feet hit the roof of the factory. You turned around to see...
131131121121222.title: The ink factory

choices: The area was still over run by ink creatures
1311311211212221.content:
It was Splotchy thankfully as he seemed to throw himself over the edge of the building with his scarf. Quickly and without any spoken words Splotchy removed the canvas from me, drew an easil, and plopped the canvas on it. Holding his thumb out to look at the blank white area infront of us before looking back at the canvas, Splotchy tilted his head before mumbling "it's been some time when I last came here, good thing I have a photographic memory."

Then the pen lashed out at the canvas as Splotchy swung it around wildly like someone going through a seizure. The sight of Splotchy attacking the canvas like a mad man was amusing, but you wondered how in the world this was able to solve the problem of the entire world being colorless. When Splotchy was finished with the painting he took it off the easil and showed it to you.

It was a very astonishing painting of a very futureistic setting, but how did this help recolor the world.
"This is the cool part" Splotchy said as he removed the canvas from in front of you face, but he didn't... did he?
You looked around to your amazement that the large technologicaly advanced buildings stood there before you. Everything seemed perfect except...
1311311211212221.title: It's All About Perspective

13113112112122211.content:
Ink creatures continued to swarmed throughout the area, covering the buildings and darting through the alleys. You knew there was no way you could fight off the entire army, even with Splotchy's skills.
“What are we going to do?” you ask Splotchy, “There's too many of them!”
“I know,” Splotchy mused, “It's quite a pickle.”
Suddenly, you spot a figure on one of the main roads, speeding towards your location on a motorcycle. A huge mass of black creatures rushes after him, and he keeps looking back and blasing them with a double-barreled shotgun. When he finally gets to your location, he looks up at you and Splotchy on the roof, and calls out, “Come with me if you want to live!” You recognize him as a T-800 Terminator, a powerful cyborg killing machine. You get on the back of the motorcycle, and Splotchy climbs into the sidecar. You peel off, pick up Rika and Renamon (whom Splotchy draws another sidecar for) and head off...
13113112112122211.title: A new ally

131131121121222111.content:
“What are you doing?!” you yell at the cyborg, who is driving straight back into town.
“Trust me, I know what I'm doing,” he replies.
As you rush down alleys, he shoots ink creatures wildly with an Uzi (9mm!) he drew from the inside of his leather jacket. You take a few sharp turns and end up in a dead end.
“What do we do now?!” you scream hysterically as the Terminator jumps off the bike and puts the Uzi away.
“Don't worry, I have planned for this,” he assures you.
He reaches into a box attached to the back of the motorcycle and pulls out an impossibly large minigun.
“Sweet shading, how did you do that?!” Splotchy exclaims.
The Terminator shrugs. “Don't ask,” he says, “I always have room for the guns I need. Now stand back.”
The four of you back up against the side of the building, as the cyborg aims his weapon into the crowd of ink creatures that have ammassed.
“Die, you inky scum!” he roars as he begins firing the minigun. Bullets spray the crowd, ink splatters, and the gun and it's wielder roar, as the ink creatures are reduced to black splatters. Finally, he drops the gun, it's ammo exhausted.
You begin to suck up some of the ink with your dropper, and things seem safe until another wave of ink creatures begin swarming over the buildings, towards the group. The Terminator re-draws his Uzi, reloads, then draws a second Uzi. He begins to fire into the crowd with both guns.
“There's too many of them!” you shout, as Splotchy rushes forward and narrowly prevents an ink creature from erasing your right arm.
“What now?” shouts Rika.
131131121121222111.title: towards the city

1311311211212221111.content:
"Rika, time to digivolve" Renamon said.

"Kyuubimon might not be enough though" Rika said, getting an idea, then scanning not one but two cards through the digvice "Digimodify, digivolution and matrix digivolution, activate!"

Light surrounded the kitsune digimon "Renamon digivolve to... KYUUBIMON!" you see her emerge as a more beast like digimon, however she wasn't done yet "Kyuubimdigivolve to..." as he new form appear she posed "Taomon". The wizard digimon smiled as a caligraphy brush slid out of her left sleeve "talisman of light!" she shouted, drawing several symbols in the air and decimating the ink creatures. Before the next wave arrives Taomon throws a piece of red paper upwards "Talisaman spell" she says, covering the group in a shield.

Rika nodded at Taomon "good work, thashould give us enough time to plan for our next move. So whats next?" she asks the momentarily stunned group.
1311311211212221111.title: Renamon digivolves

13113112112122211111.content:
"Hey, you copied MY attacks" Splotchy whined as he tried to cross his arms and pout, only to fail because of the fact that he only had one arm to cross.
Rika giggled saying "looks like someone is jealous."
"I AM NOT JEALOUS" Splotchy blurted out "I just hate it when people copy off me. Besides, I would have done that same... paper thingy that Renamon did... if I had paper..."
"This is no time for bickering" the Terminator sternly confronted them "we need to have a plan of confrontation against these black blobs."
Rika looked at Splotchy who in responce only shrugged his shoulders saying "hey, I'm an artist, not a stratagist. Besides, I thought you were the brains of that little "Digimon Tamer's" group you have?"
"Yah, but these circumstances are quite... difficult." Rika said "why not ask the guy with the sunglasses?"
The Terminator looked at them and said in a fairly stiff monotone "normaly in these kind of circumstances we would have to either find a way to escape or fight our way out, neither of wich have less than 16.598% chance of succsess."
Frend raised his hand slowly, immediatly getting everyone's attention, Splotchy asking "you have an idea?"
"Well, you know we could... split up" Frend said, starting to suffer slightly from being the center of attention, "you know, Rika and the Terminator can go with Taomon and lead the blobs away while we go the other direction and restore more color and maybe getting more people to fight with us."
Everyone's eyes lit up as Splotchy said "I think that might do the trick, just one little addition is required." Splotchy then started drawing a copy of both him and Frend saying "Taomon, carry these so that the blobs think that your carrying us too."
Taomon looked at the dummies saying "are you sure it's going to work?"
"I don't know," Splotchy replied "but it's still better than just standing here."

The plan...
13113112112122211111.title: Frend get's an idea

choices: The commander of this force arrives.
131131121121222111112.content:
As the two groups split up, both groups notice that its quiet, too quiet. As you and Splotchy walk along black ink ropes appear out of nowhere, then you black out.

When you wake up you see that its not just you and Splotchy who got captured, the others were struggling with their bonds and slowly losing colour. You try to speak up but nothing comes out. Suddenly...
131131121121222111112.title: Falls apart

1311311211212221111121.content:
Suddenly out of the darkness a green armoured figure sneaks up to the group. Holding a finger to his mouth piece, you recognise its an Eldar Striking Scorpion exarch. He uses his mandiblasters to burn apart the rope. "Are you ok mon kiegh?" the exarch asked, freeing the others "I saw you fighting those creatures, but you may need help" he added.

"Thanks for that" Splotchy said "But what do we do now?"
1311311211212221111121.title: Someone comes to the rescue

1311311221.content: As your team decides what to do you walk towards the Anime world door and curiously just as you begin to turn the knob suddenly you are knocked back by a sudden gust of wind. The door to the Anime world flies open only to reveal that of a grimmer sight than when you first arrived in Centertown. The world was just that, blank! Everywhere you looked the place was blank. There was nothing to see there. No pencil lines or sketch marks, just blank. Frankly the sight was hard to look at, not that the entire world was gone but that the white color was hurting your eyes. “Frend are you okay” Splotchy asked coming to your aid. Rika and Renamon quickly follow after him only to gasp in horror that their home world was no longer. “Rika, Renamon? What’s wrong” Splotchy asks not noticing the blank world. Rika collapses to her knees and punches the ground before her angrily. It seems that having one’s world wiped out is too much even for a tomboy like Rika to stand. You look at Splochy and ask him "Is there a way we can help her?"
1311311221.title: Anime world? But this place just blank!

choices: Was made into a blank zone
1311311222.content:
"I think the Speed world is good place to start, partialy because it's whole structure is made for racing" Splotchy explained "so if we DO get attacked we can just run off."
"So, are you saying that all we are going to do is run away in that world?" Renamon asked.
Rika agreed with Renamon "yah, we are not going to acomplish anything if we just keep running away."
You thought about it for a second before relizing what Splotchy was talking about.
"Wait, I get what your trying to say" you discovered "if we run around that world long enough and fast enough then we might find who ever is controling those ink creatures lickety split."
"Bingo" replied Splotchy "because even if it is all blank, the basis of the world still holds up, so in this case the fastest people have the most power. So the commander should be realy fast, so that more likely it means it is weak and easy to destroy."
Splotchy then opened the door and they all walked inside and found out that Speed world...
1311311222.title: Speed

choices: Try and break into the factory with Renamon
Grab a car and play tag with the cop cars
13113112221.content:
"Well, it's not like I didn't expect this" you heard Splotchy say as all of you looked at the black and white world. The world looked like a black and white version of New York with all the buildings cut to only two stories high. All of the intersections had traffic lights with only two lights, a white light and a dark grey light, while all of the cars were blocky and only came in a grey color. There wern't even any trucks, convertables, vans, ATVs, or even cargo trucks, just simple cars that looked like they were made out of square white blocks. In the center of the large world was a large grey factory billowing out black smoke while a tall parking garage stood next to it.

"If we want to defeat the commander we need to know his weakness" Rika said as she eyed the factory. "Renamon, do you think you can make it to the factory and spy on the commander?"
Renamon shrugged as she said, "I would think the Blanks would have that place surrounded by very strong defences."
"Just go ahead Renamon, we will handle there defences" Splotchy said calmly. "Just make sure you don't break the speed limit."
"Alright... I think" Renamon said with uncertanty before leaping off from roof to roof.
Rika looked at Splotchy inquisitively asking, "what's your plan."
"Plan, what plan?" Splotchy said. "All I am going to do is go on a joy ride." With that Splotchy ran over to a car and hijacked it Grand Theft Auto style by throwing the driver out. He then jammed his pen half way into the trunk of the car, making it turn green with a matching black splotch paintjob. The car started to stretch and grow untill it transformed into a nitro powered, fire throwing hot rod with jigantic rear tires and an exposed engine.
"If you don't mind, I am going to be playing tag with the cop cars" Splotchy said before the hot rod was jerked forward into a wheely.

What should you do?
13113112221.title: Was made into a blank zone

choices: You spot several coming from different directions.
You underestimated them.  They seeped through the ground below the watch tower.
Black clouds in the sky.  It's raining ink.
132.content:
You met up with Splotchy when you ran out of ink. You saw he had done the same, but a vast majority of people hadn't been colored in and just like with yourself some of the people he colored hadn't got all their color back.
"Figured as much. The beast I fell was merely a straggler sniffing around for any missed color." He then jumped up the top of the nearest house a converted his pen into a telescope to survey the surrounding area. There's some traces of color in the distance. The main group is over there. You stay behind while I return with the color."
"You can't take on a group of them, can you" you asked, unsure of his ability.
"I'll be fine, with or without you, but a more pressing matter is this town. We restored some color to the people and that will undoubtedly attack some of the creatures. You must protect them."
"How can I? I don't have a weapon like you?"
"You have the the eye dropper. It'll serve as a weapon for now, but be on your guard, to steal your color is the same as robbing you of your life. Don't allow them one inch and beware their tricks. They pray on those who are indecisive. Remember don't start what you don't intend to see to the end."
With that he walked off, leaving you alone in the town. The few villages you revive had gone about searching for their loved ones. You placed yourself in a colorless lookout tower in the center of the village to keep an eye out for any of the creatures coming in from the distance.
132.title: Splitting Up

choices: You follow him into the forest.
He takes you to a clear plain to begin training.
You walk down a dirt road to get as far away there as fast as possible.
15.content:
No sooner had they arrived then a group of ink-like monsters came at them. You fell back to stay within safe range, but Splotchy charge forward, pulling out a pen from within himself and attack the creatures, pulling them into the pen. Within a minute he had captured them all. He then pulled out an empty ink bottle and emptied the pen into it, but despite the volume they originally had only a drop fell from the pen.
"What just happened?" you asked confused.
"They were creatures of ink, not too different than myself. They were created by an evil man. Their true form is in this ink bottle now."
"But why were they only a drop?"
"They strength varies by how much ink they are made of. A single drop could make several like you saw. Many mindless underlings, but much more terrifying things can be created."
"Like what?"
"Never mind that now. We're being watched."
"What?"
"We were attacked the moment we got here meaning we've been followed and they anticipated we'd be here."
Splotchy caught something in the corner of his eye and vansihed. He reappeared near a tree adn attack a flock of black birds in a tree. He swung at them with a pen, causing them to turn into a viscuss shape and then drew them into his pen. He emptied it into the ink bottle, but he obviously realized something I didn't and stared back at the tree and then into the sky. In the distance there was a single black bird ink creature that escaped. He punched the ground in anger.
"It's alright, you got most of them."
"It'll only take one to send word to their master. He didn't realize I was with you so their force came with minimal strength to get you. We must get away fast. If you wish to live you better let me teach you to fight or you'll be done for."
He offered his hand out for you to shake it. You didn't see much choice so you shook his hand and followed him.
15.title: Warm Welcome

choices: A Black & White Toyota Treuno AE86
155.content:
after a good twenty minutes on the dirt road

yourself - How much longer is there on this road

Splotchy - Don't know exatly

they carry on walking for two minutes

Yourself - Lets take a brake for a bit

Splotchy - o.k

then they hear a engine or engines in the distance

Yourself - Hey, i can hear cars coming

Splotchy - you right

they see a...
155.title: the endless dirt road

info.brief_description: You fight for your life in a world containing all your favorite fictional characters
info.description:
You are the creation of a young child, kind of like an imagenary friend, but right after your creation you were sent to a strange land where all the characters made by anyone and everyone reside. Original characters, fan characters, and several characters that have been put into history like Nemo, Sonic, Mario, and even Superman to talk about a few, live inside a jiant world. Unfortunatly somthing strange has been happening as the doors leading to the five other worlds are locked. What in the world is happening.

Rules:
-Keep everything PG 13 please
-Keep cusing to a minimum
-Stay in character (Darth Vader isn't going to join the light side and sonic isn't going to slow down for you)
-Keep things reasonable (no one has unlimited power, ultimate defence and some well known character isn't going to magicaly pop up and suddenly help you. Deal with it)
-No shriking, WG, or any other stuff like that
-Characters are not allowed to enter other doors ((you will know what I am talking about later))
-And at least write one paragraph per addition please
-Also, have fun
